Ad Text:
About the Client: A Sydney-based utilities provider leveraging advanced data and AI technologies to drive operational efficiency and customer innovation. This role supports a short-term initiative focused on deploying scalable machine learning solutions using Microsoft Azure and Databricks.

About the Role: We are seeking a Junior Machine Learning Engineer to support the design, development, and deployment of ML solutions on Azure and Databricks. This Sydney CBD-based role offers the opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI/ML projects, including Generative AI and LLM implementations, within a collaborative and fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:
Build and maintain ML pipelines using Azure Databricks.
Support data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, and deployment.
Collaborate with Data Scientists to productionise models.
Use Azure ML services for experimentation and model management.
Assist in deploying LLM and GenAI solutions, including RAG architectures.
Work with Python, PySpark, and SQL for data processing and analysis.
Contribute to CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps.
Monitor model performance and troubleshoot issues.
Required Experience:
2+ years in AI/ML engineering, ideally in cloud environments.
Hands-on experience with Azure Databricks and Azure ML.
Proficiency in Python (including PySpark) and SQL.
Understanding of ML algorithms, deep learning, and MLOps.
Exposure to containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).
Experience with Generative AI or LLMs is a strong advantage.
What’s on Offer? This is a contract opportunity:

3-month contract with possible extension
$460/day package
Sydney CBD location
Work on innovative AI/ML projects with modern cloud tools
How to Apply: To express interest, please upload your resume. Suitable candidates will be contacted with further instructions.
📩 Contact Dylan Sheoshker at dylans@whizdom.com.au or 📞 0480 002 456

About the Company
  
Join a purpose-driven organisation that is transforming the way healthcare is delivered. Backed by strong leadership and investment in Data & AI, the business is building intelligent platforms that empower clinicians, streamline workflows, and ultimately improve patient outcomes.
  
This is an exciting stage of growth where your contributions will directly influence how advanced technologies are applied in real-world settings. 
  
About the Role
  
We are seeking a Senior AI Engineer to design, build, and scale AI-powered solutions that drive clinical and operational intelligence. This role combines deep technical AI/ML expertise with a product-focused mindset. You’ll work across the full lifecycle of AI development, from prototyping and prompt engineering through to secure, production-grade deployment.
  
Reporting to the Director of Data & AI, you will collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and clinical experts to deliver solutions that are safe, explainable, and impactful in real-world use cases.
  
Key Responsibilities

Create and optimise LLM-driven features that enable summarisation, information extraction, and workflow automation
Build scalable frameworks for prompt engineering, context management and RAG pipelines
Develop machine learning models for prediction, anomaly detection, and regression models for clinical applications
Leverage structured and unstructured datasets to design features and train robust models
Integrate ML/AI services into core applications using modern cloud and containerised deployment methods
Establish monitoring and guardrails to ensure models remain safe and reliable
Strengthen engineering practices by contributing to reviews, documentation, and technical design
Required Experience

5+ years deep Machine Learning experience, including 2+ years building LLM-powered applications, and ability to deliver AI/ML solutions into user-facing products
Advanced Python development skills (eg FastAPI, Flask)
Hands-on expertise with open-source LLM tooling (eg LangChain, LlamaIndex) and RAG pipeline development
Solid knowledge of AWS cloud services and containerised deployment (eg Docker, ECS, Lambda)
Experience implementing monitoring and evaluation for LLMs and ML models (e.g. Langfuse)
Proven knowledge of semantic search, embeddings, and vector databases
Domain experience in healthcare or medical NLP preferred
Why Apply?

$180,000-$200,000 base + super
Super flexible model, 1 day onsite in Sydney
Opportunity to shape a growing AI function in a supportive, collaborative environment
Work on meaningful projects where technology directly improves lives
Great growth potential and career progression 
If you’re looking for meaningful challenges, the freedom to innovate, and the opportunity to shape something with long-lasting impact, then this is your opportunity. Apply now!

About the Company:

Are you ready to join the Liebherr family?

Liebherr-Australia’s experience, knowledge, and dedication to the highest quality and most reliable technology, makes us a respected leader and a trustworthy partner to industry. We sell and service earthmoving machinery, mining equipment, mobile cranes, tower cranes, maritime cranes as well as foundation and piling equipment throughout Australia and New Zealand. 

About the Role:

We're excited to welcome a new System Support Engineer into Liebherr to provide advanced Technical Support to the Liebherr Onboard Autonomy Kit and Autonomous Haulage Solution.

Working an even time roster, as part of the 24 / 7 Global Product Owner team, the role provides real-time assistance, including remote monitoring and on-site support, where required, to ensure maximum uptime and reliability of the Onboard Autonomy Kit.

The position will be instrumental in timely resolution of system failures / bugs in accordance with SLA timeframes.

With deep expertise in electro-mechanical systems, software troubleshooting, autonomous vehicle technology, and a commitment to operational excellence, the System Support Engineer – Onboard Autonomy is responsible for diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving complex software and system issues while ensuring uninterrupted operation across global autonomous mining fleets. 

Skills and Duties:

To succeed in this role, you will need Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Robotics or Mechatronics) or related discipline.

Specific development experience with heavy, off road, or mining vehicles and / or autonomous haulage systems is highly desirable.

·         Experience in Linux-based systems and troubleshooting distributed software architectures

·         Knowledge of software programming tools (ex. Linux, C++, etc.)

·         Knowledge of communication protocols (ex. Ethernet, CAN J1939, DDS, etc.).

·         Knowledge of diagnostic tools necessary to analyse embedded onboard connected systems, (ex. Vector Canalyzer, SQL Database)

·         Knowledge of ITSM tools (ex. JIRA, Service Now)

·         Knowledge of real-time embedded systems

·         Knowledge of open-source development tools (e.g. ROS2)

·         Knowledge of autonomous system technology principles including perception, pose, and self- localization/mapping

·         Troubleshoot complex systems related to onboard autonomy, robotic behaviours, and drive by wire systems

·         Troubleshoot obstacle detection algorithms and summarize performance metrics

·         Knowledge of system modelling techniques using MATLAB/Simulink

·         Calibrate and troubleshoot perception stack sensors including but not limited to Lidar and radar.

Essential:

·         Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Robotics or Mechatronics) or a related field; and

·         3+ years of experience in software engineering with exposure to large-scale autonomous or industrial systems.




We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live, work and operate. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, teamwork and diversity of thought in the workplace.

Culture:

We are dedicated to seeing our employees work together in an environment that fosters the true meaning of collaboration; a culture that creates the highest quality, cutting-edge products, long-lasting relationships, and improved organisational and individual capabilities.

We aim to give our employees an opportunity to grow and develop their careers.

Benefits:

Paid Parental Leave | Bonus Leave | Purchase Leave | Early Access to LSL Corporate Health Insurance | Novated Lease | Travel Club Liebherr One Hub – Employee Discount Portal for Great Savings Soft skills and Leadership training programs. 

Please note: Applicants successful in progressing past interview stage will be required to undergo a Preemployment process including National Police Clearance and Medical Screening process which includes drug and alcohol testing.

Liebherr Australia would like to thank you for submitting your application.




No agencies or third parties please.

LCI is seeking a Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) Engineer for our Sydney office. We are an engineering design house specialising in building services. We employ over 270 staff within six offices across Australia.  We’ve built a phenomenal team.… and we are continuing to grow.

We see our colleagues as family, and we pride ourselves on hiring and shaping passionate professionals who thrive in a diverse and collaborative environment. We operate within a culture of trust and flexibility and this is a great opportunity to be part of a growing and collaborative team.                             

The ideal candidate will be a junior/intermediate engineer with experience in CFD modelling, or a graduate engineer with exposure to CFD modelling. They will be involved in technical consulting within the ESD team and be working closely with other ESD consultants and/or mechanical engineers. Day-to-day activities will predominantly consist of performing CFD studies on various projects with a focus on data centres.

Desirable Requirements for this role included: -

Experience within an engineering consultancy.

An understanding of wind engineering.

An understanding of mechanical heat rejection systems.

Experience with Ansys Fluent and/or OpenFOAM.

Experience with Python and/or C/C++.

Experience with ESD and/or energy modelling with IES.

Experience with parametric modelling tools such as Grasshopper.

Skills & Experience

Engineering degree with exposure to fluid mechanics and some experience with CFD.

Ability to work independently with a small team.

Excellent written and verbal communication.

 Our colleagues enjoy:

Opportunity for further education through the LCI Learning & Growth Program.

One LCI Benefits Program which is a program which covers hundreds of retailers including food, fashion, travel, entertainment, insurance and much, much more.  

A social, collaborative and inclusive culture with regular social and networking events organised throughout the year.

Eight (8) weeks parental leave after 12 months continuous service.

Employee Referral Program

Paid Professional Membership

Passion Day – a day off each year just because!

Access to an Employee Assistance Program

Volunteering Leave – one day off per calendar year.

See yourself working in a dynamic, friendly and innovative environment?  Are you ready to take the next step in your career?  We’d love to meet you.

Please apply now with your cover letter explaining why you think you are the ideal candidate along with a copy of your resume.

In this era of technology and globalisation, we recognise cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce is more important than ever for both our staff and business. By advocating fair and equitable access to employment, we foster social integration and enable our staff to perform to their full potential. At LCI, we do not tolerate any discrimination based on race, gender, age, cultural background, sexual orientation, mental and physical conditions, political beliefs, religion, as well as other distinct differences between people.

For more information about LCI, please visit our website at www.lciconsultants.com.au.

Agencies need not send applicants as we are managing all recruitment directly. LCI will not accept any unsolicited resumes from recruiters or recruitment agencies. Any unsolicited resumes will be deemed to be the property of LCI and in the absence of a signed Agreement, LCI will not consider or agree to any payment of any recruitment fee.

Join our “Innovation Lab” to improve the customer experience with cutting-edge solutions and groundbreaking ideas.

12-months fixed term

ConnectEast is the owner and operator of EastLink, Melbourne’s largest tollway network. Since opening in 2008, EastLink has established a reputation as one of Melbourne’s busiest and safest motorways.

About the role:

ConnectEast’s “Innovation Lab” is at the forefront of accelerating our AI maturity by delivering real-world, high-impact solutions through agile experimentation and cross-functional collaboration. Our mission is to embed AI, data analytics, and automation into everyday work, solving business challenges, upskilling staff, and creating reusable tools and governance models that scale across the enterprise.

The Automation Specialist is a hands-on technical contributor within the Innovation Lab, responsible for designing, prototyping, and delivering solutions that address real business challenges enabled via AI, data analytics, and automation. This role blends agile development, rapid experimentation, and cross-functional collaboration to build minimum viable products (MVPs), pilots, and scalable tools

Within this role, you will (but not limited to):

·        Build and iterate on prototypes using tools such as Microsoft CoPilot, Power Automate, Power BI, and lightweight Machine Learning frameworks.

·        Translate user stories into functional deliverables within 2-week sprint cycles while following PRINCE2 Agile delivery methodology

·        Develop and maintain reusable components, scripts, and dashboard, while engineering data pipelines and integrating operational systems for use cases.

·        Apply rule-based logic, Machine Learning models, and automation workflows to solve business problems, ensuring traceability, compliance, and performance of technical solutions.

·        Actively participate in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, reviews, and retrospectives, collaborating with the Scrum Master, Product Owners, and Cross-Functional Team Members to refine backlog items and deliver outcomes.

·        Document technical decisions, patterns, and learnings for lab reuse and to ensure solutions are documented for the future.

·        Work closely with business stakeholders to co-create solutions and engage in user testing, feedback loops, and showcases to validate and improve deliverables.

·        Support capability uplift by mentoring peers and sharing technical knowledge while embedding ethical and governance considerations into solution design.

·        Ensure data privacy, consent, and compliance protocols are followed in all builds

About you:

To be successful in this role you will bring strong analytical thinking and troubleshooting capabilities along with your passion for experimentation and continuous improvement. You will be familiar with and have had exposure to PRINCE2 Agile methodology and proven experience in sprint-based delivery and agile collaboration. You will utilise your strong communication and stake holder engagement skills while working collaboratively with business stakeholders, IT, and other teams to co-create and validate technical solutions.

You will also have:

·        A tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Data Science, Engineering, or similar disciplines

·        PRINCE2 Agile certification and Microsoft certification in tools such as Microsoft CoPilot, Power Automate, and Power BI will be highly regarded.

·        Minimum three years’ experience in designing and delivering automation solutions in cross-functional environments, ideally within innovation, digital transformation, or operational improvement contexts.

·        Minimum three years’ experience with low-code/no-code platforms such as Microsoft CoPilot, Power Automate, and Power BI.

·        Proven track record of building data-driven workflows, integrating systems, and applying rule-based logic or lightweight ML models to solve business problems.

·        Hands-on experience in agile development environments, including sprint-based delivery, backlog refinement, and iterative prototyping.

·        Prior involvement in pilot projects, MVPs, or proof-of-concept builds that demonstrate measurable business value.

·        Familiarity with data privacy, compliance, and ethical considerations in automation and AI-enabled environments.

·        Technical Proficiency in low-code/no-code platforms such as Power Automate and Power Apps.

·        Strong understanding of data visualisation tools like Power BI.

·        Familiarity with AI / Machine Learning concepts and tools (e.g., Microsoft CoPilot, Azure ML).

·        Ability to translate business requirements into scalable automation solutions.

·        Experience in building and iterating on prototypes, MVPs, and pilots.

·        Skilled in developing reusable components and automation workflows.

What we can offer you:

A nurturing environment allowing employees to grow and develop within an inclusive environment.

Free counselling services through the Employee Assistance Program.

Micro market and café, including free coffee and fruit.

Access to ConnectEast’s Wellbeing program, including morning teas, onsite massages, and fitness program. 

Ready to apply?

In your application, please highlight relevant skills and experience that you can bring to this role.

Appointment to this position is subject to a National Police Clearance and your eligibility to work in Australia.

If this role sounds of interest to you, please refer to the Employee Information Kit at www.eastlink.com.au for more information.

Applications must include a cover letter and current resume and must be submitted prior to Close of Business on Friday 3rd October  2025.

ConnectEast values and embraces diversity and inclusion within our employee group. We are One Team working seamlessly together. Safety is at the forefront of our decision making. We are Accountable for our actions and deliver on our commitments. We respect one another and We Care for every one of our employees, colleagues, customers and the environment.

The Role

As an EL 1 Human Factors (HF) Specialist in the Directorate of Specialist Engineering within Land Engineering Agency (LEA), you will ensure that Human Factors are effectively integrated into the design and acquisition of Land systems. This role requires expertise in understanding human capabilities, limitations, and behaviours to optimise human-system performance and minimise risk. You will ensure the user and their capabilities are fully considered across all phases of the capability life cycle. 

This will include; 

Identification, management and mitigation of human-systems risks; 
Incorporation of HF in project documents and activities (user requirements, functional and performance specifications, contractual documents, test and evaluation, etc.);
Provision of specialist advice to a range of stakeholders; 
Production of Human Systems Integration (HSI) policy and guidance; and 
Working in partnership with key domestic and international stakeholders, within and outside Defence.  
You will be responsible for advocacy, education, and coaching of HSI across LEA and Defence stakeholders.

About our Team

Land Systems Division’s (LSD) mission is to acquire and support capability that enables the ADF to generate and sustain deployable Land power for an integrated force, in peace and war. We aim to be agile, innovative and outcomes-focussed as we collaborate closely with the Services and industry to deliver the latest equipment to maximise ADF performance. 

LEA, as part of CASG, supports various Projects and Systems Program Offices (SPO) to ensure successful technical outcomes of Defence acquisition and in-service support of land materiel. LEA provides services in engineering, testing, design and development, technical data and configuration management across the Defence Capability Life Cycle. 

LSD is dedicated to providing staff with an inclusive and healthy work-life environment, and we will invest in your ongoing professional development to ensure your work with us is deeply rewarding. 

Our Ideal Candidate

Our ideal candidate will be an experienced scientist/engineering professional with a tertiary qualification in HF or related discipline. You will have a deep technical knowledge and experience in the application of HF and HSI to design, development, acquisition and sustainment of systems. Experience in Defence is preferable but not essential. 

You will have strong knowledge and experience of different areas of HF/HSI such as:

Anthropometry 
Workload analysis
Early Human Factors Analysis 
Risk identification 
Requirements definition 
HSI plans 
Human machine interface analysis 
System safety and human error analyses 
User data collection including test & evaluation and statistical analysis 
HSI assurance activities.  

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills are required. You will be able to work with a degree of autonomy but also work well as part of a team and actively foster a supportive, collaborative team environment. You will be responsible for planning HSI support, mentoring, and reviewing deliverables.

Application Closing Date: Sunday 28 September 2025

For further information please review the job information pack, reference CASG/07431/25 on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=6A2E52B1-B8D1-375D-514A-E4331A46C2BA

About The Borg Group

The Borg Group is a leading privately-owned Australian enterprise with a strong presence in manufacturing, recycling, and property development. Founded in 1989 by brothers John and Michael Borg, the company is headquartered in Somersby, New South Wales, and employs nearly 2,700 people across Australia and New Zealand.

Borg is committed to environmental responsibility, actively integrating sustainable practices into its operations. Initiatives such as reDirect Recycling and Direct Pallets play a key role in reclaiming materials like used formwork, trusses, plywood, particleboard, and pallets. These efforts not only reduce landfill waste but also contribute to the production of recycled-content particleboard.

Innovation is a cornerstone of Borg’s success. The company continually invests in automation and advanced technologies, driving new product development and maintaining its position at the cutting edge of the industry. Its world-class manufacturing facilities are a testament to this forward-thinking approach.

Borg’s diverse portfolio includes several prominent brands, notably polytec and Porta.

polytec is a renowned Australian brand offering decorative surface solutions for both residential and commercial interiors. It is a favourite among designers and renovators across the country for its style and quality.

Porta is a trusted supplier of premium timber and panel products for the construction industry. Known for its deep expertise and commitment to innovation, Porta delivers strength, quality, and reliability to every project.

 
About the Role

We’re building a small, agile Digital Hub to pioneer practical digital and AI solutions across Borg. To do that, we’re looking for an AI Solutions Specialist who can turn AI advancements into tools people actually use.

This role is hands-on: prototyping chatbots, building smart assistants, testing predictive models, and embedding AI into workflows. You’ll be working closely with business teams to spot opportunities, prototype quickly, and refine solutions that make work simpler, faster, and smarter.

What you’ll do

Prototype and deploy AI-powered tools like chatbots, assistants, and search/find features.

Apply AI APIs (OpenAI, Hugging Face, Azure OpenAI, etc.) to enhance workflows and decision-making.

Partner with Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, and Logistics to test and refine solutions.

Analyse datasets to uncover insights and support forecasting and optimisation pilots.

Embed AI into existing systems (ERP, CRM, and other systems) through APIs and integrations.

Share knowledge and help drive adoption through demos, training, and user support.

What you’ll bring

Strong Python skills for prototyping and data handling.

Experience with AI/ML libraries (OpenAI, Hugging Face, LangChain, etc.).

Ability to analyse and communicate insights with tools like Pandas or Power BI.

API integration skills (REST, JSON, authentication methods).

2+ years’ experience delivering applied AI or automation projects.

Strong communicator who can explain AI simply to non-technical users.

Bonus points for

Knowledge of vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Qdrant).

Exposure to business process automation or RPA is a plus.

Exposure to deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).

Familiarity with Azure, AWS, or GCP.

Why join us?

You’ll be part of a pioneering team shaping how AI is applied across Borg. We move fast, experiment boldly, and focus on delivering solutions that matter. If you’re curious, pragmatic, and excited to make AI real for business, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now and help us lead the way in applied AI.







Borg is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company description:



Join us and let's make a bigger difference together.

Established in 1840, we're Australia's first member-owned wellbeing company. Today we have over $1 billion in revenue and provide smart solutions and services to more than 700,000 Australians. We employ over 7000 people and our purpose is to Help People to Thrive.

It's an exciting time to be joining Australian Unity - we have grown significantly over recent years and are transforming to capitalise on further growth opportunities to help our customers and employees thrive. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value. Australian Unity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.



Job description:



We currently have two opportunities (permanent, and 12-month fixed term) for a Senior Data Engineer who will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable ETL/ELT pipelines leveraging automated testing, continuous build, continuous integration, continuous delivery and deployment practices. Additionally, the role involves development and delivery of intra-day streaming activities that supports business objectives. The incumbent will be the chapter lead with oversight of standards, coaching and mentoring data engineers and graduate data engineers.

Accountabilities include:

Design and implement strong ELT/ETL ingestion frameworks, standards, and templates to ensure consistent delivery.
Maintain and continue to enhance the data orchestration and transformation from a wide variety of sources leveraging cloud data services.
Implement data governance, automated testing and validation for excellent process execution.
Develop intra-day streaming capability.
Uphold high code quality with comprehensive test coverage, adhering to industry best practices.
Create CI/CD continuous integration and continuous delivery framework for accelerated deployment.
Physicalise conceptual and logical data models.
Document critical design decisions, technical and interface specifications, and data flows to maintain clarity and transparency throughout projects.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to elicit, document, and analyse their requirements thoroughly.

About You:

To be successful in the role you will be able to demonstrate the following capabilities / experience:

A strong understanding of data engineering practices, techniques, and associated data governance principles in terms of data sharing and accessibility.
Proven experience working on cloud data platforms and developing data solutions in cloud.
Strong Software Engineering experience with proficiency in at least one high-level programming language.
Deep software quality assurance skills, with expertise in diagnosing and resolving issues.
Demonstrated experience with CI/CD practices & tools eliciting optimised outcomes.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven experience creating reusable frameworks and pipelines with a strategic approach.

What's on Offer:

You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:

Competitive salary + bonus program
Enjoy additional yearly Well-Being and Community leave days
14-week paid parental leave, with equal benefit for both parents
Employee Referral Program
Employee Assistance Program - support and assistance for you and your partner at those times in life when you need it most
Maxxia Rewards - a great range of discounts and benefits at selected retail outlets, department stores, attractions, travel, cinemas, restaurants.
Discounts across the Australian Unity business including Private Health Insurance, General Insurance + more!
Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform

For further benefits visit: https://www.australianunity.com.au/careers/culture

Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.

Energetic, fun, and collaborative team atmosphere
Join a dynamic and forward-thinking business
Thrive in a fast-paced environment


About DUAL

Driven by a vision to be the world's best underwriting business, DUAL has always taken a different approach to our industry peers.

Since our business was founded in 2004, we have had a strong entrepreneurial spirit that runs through every part of our business. We empower our people to develop products, services and processes that deliver consistently for our partners. As a company we're known in the industry as a group dedicated to giving back to the community by partnering with charitable groups and actively participating in fundraising events. Whatever you are looking for in a career, we want to help you do more.

Our philosophy is simple: we genuinely put people first and want our people to be the healthiest and happiest they can be, at work and at home. We aim to attract and retain the best talent, and support them to achieve their aspirations. It's how we grow our business and keep one step ahead of our competitors.

About the Role

We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our Reporting & Analytics team, with expertise in Power BI. This role would suit individuals excelling in data engineering and business intelligence, building scalable data pipelines, and optimising data models for impactful Power BI reporting.

Play a key role in crafting how data flows through our systems and how it's presentation to our stakeholders. We want you to ensure our reporting infrastructure is robust, efficient, and future ready!

Role Responsibilities
Build and maintain enterprise-grade Power BI datasets, reports, and dashboards.
Compose, construct, and uphold scalable ETL pipelines employing tools like Azure Data Factory and SQL.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and governance across all reporting layers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to determine data requirements and successfully implement solutions.
Continuously improve and automate data processes to maintain a flawless reporting infrastructure.
Supply technical knowledge and assistance following best practices to continuously improve and automate our data processes.
About You

Seeking a proficient Data Engineer specialising in Power BI with at least 5 years of experience. Your forte includes constructing scalable data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and fostering collaboration within teams. You promote procedures and strive for continuous automation and enhancement of data processes. Your proactive nature and adept problem-solving make you an indispensable team member.

How to Apply

Are you the right fit for this role and the DUAL Team? Tell us why in a short paragraph that you share along with your Resume to our HR Team.

What you might not expect…

At DUAL we value work/life balance, health and wellbeing, family and giving back, which is why our benefits are reflective of this. We provide employees with a competitive salary and benefits, which will be flexible and dependent on the successful candidate's individual skills and experience.

Our culture: people first

Our core values dictate how we live and work. We're a group with independence and people
at its heart and we're a home for talent with a unique culture: the biggest small company in
the world.

The focus on being a people-first business has always been at the very heart of the group; Our vision was to create an independent business with a unique culture and one that would survive and thrive as a business controlled by the people working for it. And finding the most talented and entrepreneurial people to join the group has been and will continue to be key.

EEO Statement

Help us think differently. As a business we're on a journey to build an inclusive workplace where our people feel welcome to bring their whole and true self to work, where differences are accepted and where our words and actions are inclusive. Together we are learning, sharing stories, and achieving change.

Get in touch

To find out more about DUAL Australia including who we are, what we're up to and what we're about, head to the DUAL Australia website or visit us on our LinkedIn page.

Ad Text:
Position: Data Engineer

Salary: $157,690- $184,761 plus 15.4% superannuation

Employment type: Full-time Ongoing

Location: Sydney, Canberra, Brisbane or Adelaide

Want to work with an organisation that drives financial inclusion and economic empowerment with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people? Well, we've got just the job for you…

About IBA

At Indigenous Business Australia (IBA), we partner and invest with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who want to own their future. We go further than providing money - we invest in people, places and ideas that are ready. We help make them real. We’re deeply invested in the financial success and economic independence of Indigenous Australians. It’s why we exist.

We offer a range of services to help Indigenous Australians create wealth, seize investment opportunities, build businesses, and purchase homes. We do this with a commercial mindset and by building respectful, productive partnerships across communities, government, and the private sector.

Our people are invested, informed, responsive, respectful and connected.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Information & Technology team and contribute to the development and maintenance of our data infrastructure. Your expertise will support various programs in making data-driven decisions, and you will play a key part in optimising our data architecture to meet evolving business needs.

About the role

Are you a hands-on data engineering expert ready to build modern, scalable solutions in a purpose-driven organisation? IBA is modernising its Azure-based data platform using Microsoft Fabric, and we’re looking for a Data Engineer to help design and deliver high-performing, secure, and scalable data solutions that support enterprise analytics and decision-making.

What you’ll bring to the team

Awareness and understanding of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander societies and culture.
Ability to liaise and communicate sensitively and effectively with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander staff. 
Tertiary qualifications in IT, Data Science, Engineering, Business, or equivalent experience.
10+ years in IT, with 5+ years in Azure Data Warehouse and Data Factory or equivalent.
Experience with Microsoft Fabric, OneLake, and Power Platform
Proficiency in SQL and PySpark,, and exposure to metadata-driven frameworks
CI/CD and DevOps experience, including Git integration
Knowledge of lakehouse architecture, delta tables, and modern storage patterns
Strong experience with Power BI, including semantic models and interactive reports
Strong communication, collaboration, and adaptability
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate (desirable)

What you will get in return

A values-based organisation committed to Indigenous economic empowerment.
15.4% employer superannuation contribution.
Not-for-profit status with access to salary packaging.
4 weeks annual leave, with options for half-pay or purchased leave.
Paid Christmas shutdown without leave deduction.
Flexible working arrangements.
Professional development opportunities.
18 days personal/carer’s leave.
 NAIDOC leave.
 First Nations Ceremonial Leave.
Cultural Leave.

Want to know more about IBA?

Visit www.iba.gov.au

Applications close: 25 September 2025

Please note: Emailed applications will not be accepted, nor will applications from recruitment agencies

Senior Data Engineer – Snowflake
  

Sydney Location or Melbourne location
Fast growing Data Analytics Consultancy
Permanent position with career development and amazing culture
  
About the Role

This Dynamic and rapidly expanding business is looking to add a Senior Data Engineer with deep expertise in Snowflake and modern data architectures to join their growing consulting team.

You will lead the design, architecture, and delivery of scalable, metadata-driven data platforms and pipelines, working closely with clients to shape solutions that drive measurable business impact.

The role

Data Modeling: Design, build, and maintain scalable data models for internal and client-specific analytics.
ETL Development: Collaborate with data engineers to create efficient ETL/ELT pipelines, transforming raw data into usable datasets.
Data Transformation: Use tools like dbt and coleasce for SQL-based transformations, delivering organized datasets for analysis.
Analytics Solutions: Ensure seamless integration of analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) with data sources in collaboration with data analysts and BI teams.
Data Quality & Governance: Maintain data accuracy through automated testing and data governance protocols.
Client Engagement: Partner with clients to understand their challenges and translate them into technical solutions.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to support data-driven decision-making.
Performance Optimization: Continuously monitor and improve the scalability and efficiency of data pipelines and models.
 About You

Proficiency in SQL and experience with modern data transformation tools (e.g., dbt, Coalesce).
Experience with cloud platforms like Snowflake, BigQuery, Fabric, or Databricks.
Advanced SQL skills (5+ years), including expertise in complex queries, stored procedures, and managing views.
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes.
Ability to build compelling data visualizations and dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Excellent communication skills for explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Proven experience in designing and maintaining real-time analytics solutions.
How to Apply: Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your experience and how you meet the selection criteria to md@limelightpeople.com.au. Include any relevant examples demonstrating your expertise in Data Analytics and Snowflake

Ad Text:
Position: Data Engineer

Salary: $157,690- $184,761 plus 15.4% superannuation

Employment type: Full-time Ongoing

Location: Sydney, Canberra, Brisbane or Adelaide

Want to work with an organisation that drives financial inclusion and economic empowerment with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people? Well, we've got just the job for you…

About IBA

At Indigenous Business Australia (IBA), we partner and invest with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who want to own their future. We go further than providing money - we invest in people, places and ideas that are ready. We help make them real. We’re deeply invested in the financial success and economic independence of Indigenous Australians. It’s why we exist.

We offer a range of services to help Indigenous Australians create wealth, seize investment opportunities, build businesses, and purchase homes. We do this with a commercial mindset and by building respectful, productive partnerships across communities, government, and the private sector.

Our people are invested, informed, responsive, respectful and connected.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Information & Technology team and contribute to the development and maintenance of our data infrastructure. Your expertise will support various programs in making data-driven decisions, and you will play a key part in optimising our data architecture to meet evolving business needs.

About the role

Are you a hands-on data engineering expert ready to build modern, scalable solutions in a purpose-driven organisation? IBA is modernising its Azure-based data platform using Microsoft Fabric, and we’re looking for a Data Engineer to help design and deliver high-performing, secure, and scalable data solutions that support enterprise analytics and decision-making.

What you’ll bring to the team

Awareness and understanding of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander societies and culture.
Ability to liaise and communicate sensitively and effectively with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander staff. 
Tertiary qualifications in IT, Data Science, Engineering, Business, or equivalent experience.
10+ years in IT, with 5+ years in Azure Data Warehouse and Data Factory or equivalent.
Experience with Microsoft Fabric, OneLake, and Power Platform
Proficiency in SQL and PySpark,, and exposure to metadata-driven frameworks
CI/CD and DevOps experience, including Git integration
Knowledge of lakehouse architecture, delta tables, and modern storage patterns
Strong experience with Power BI, including semantic models and interactive reports
Strong communication, collaboration, and adaptability
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate (desirable)

What you will get in return

A values-based organisation committed to Indigenous economic empowerment.
15.4% employer superannuation contribution.
Not-for-profit status with access to salary packaging.
4 weeks annual leave, with options for half-pay or purchased leave.
Paid Christmas shutdown without leave deduction.
Flexible working arrangements.
Professional development opportunities.
18 days personal/carer’s leave.
 NAIDOC leave.
 First Nations Ceremonial Leave.
Cultural Leave.

Want to know more about IBA?

Visit www.iba.gov.au

Code: S12

Genetic Signatures improves patient care and outcomes by developing innovative diagnostic technologies which simplify molecular pathology.

We are an Australian based manufacturer selling into leading pathology laboratories in Australia, and distributing worldwide, and are looking to expand our diverse, supportive and talented team. 

We are now seeking a solutions focused Systems Integration Engineer – Process, to join our dynamic Systems Integration team. This role plays a key part in gathering and documenting requirements for workflows (reagents, software and hardware) in our development pipeline, enabling Genetic Signatures to bring its innovative molecular diagnostic technology to customers, driving better patient care and outcomes.

 

In this role you will be responsible for:

·         Gather requirements through drafting product requirements from customer requirements (inclusive of workflow, reagents, hardware and software requirement.

·         Author and/or review software requirement specifications or technical requirement specifications

·         Design and generate traceability matrix for requirements and test cases for the system

·         Act as technical contact for internal/external customers and suppliers during product development. 

·         Consult with external design engineers (internal and/or OEM vendors) to understand system functionality and coordinate the implementation of requirements and design specifications.

·         Review test cases authored by other development experts to verify requirements

·         Understand business needs and identify necessary integrations between different systems, analysing data formats and functionalities to design and test integration solutions.

·         Initiate, coordinate and or execute activity for test campaigns to verify requirements and design specifications and ensure conformance to intended use of products.

·         Collect, analyse, and develop report packages to support system verification and validations.

·         Initiate &/coordinate and conduct reliability analysis, testability analysis, software reliability, fault tolerance, and system stress analysis on instrument systems that run diagnostic assays.

·         Review and/or develop detailed Failure Modes and Effects Analysis of systems with the ability to assess critical to quality elements.

 

To be successful as our process-oriented Systems Integration Engineer – Process, you will possess talent in:

·         Molecular biology including real time PCR

·         Engineering or validation for IVDs or other regulated products

·         Software, product, process or equipment validation

·         Requirements management software

·         Integrated software/hardware workflows

·         Understanding of design inputs/outputs, with experience writing technical documentation

·         Versed in regulatory standards, including ISO13485, ISO14971, and IEC62304

·         Process- and solution-oriented mindset

·         Written and verbal communication skills

·         Self-starting with ability to work both independently and in a team

 

You will also hold a bachelor’s degree in science, engineering, or related field (master’s or PhD advantageous).

 

It is advantageous if you are experienced in the medical device industry and validation of products / services in the diagnostics / life sciences marketplace/s and have an understanding of methylation field.

 

Genetic Signatures Ltd is committed to providing equal employment opportunities, we thrive on the diversity of thought that comes to us through our workforce and encourage anyone possessing the talent and drive to better health care for their community to apply.

If you are interested in applying for this role, please apply via seek or send your resume and cover letter to careers@geneticsignatures.com. We kindly ask external recruitment agencies not to submit applications. Should we need agency support, we will get in touch directly.

Quantum-Systems is more than a workplace. We are transforming the way data is acquired and decisions are made through our AI-powered unmanned aerial systems. We play to change the game. To make our mark on the center stage.

Do you have what it takes?

Quantum-Systems Australia is seeking a Linux Software Engineer.

Don't miss this opportunity to join us as we develop our world-class capability right here in Redbank. With major contracts in process and more on the way, this role will offer amazing experience for the right candidate.

Bring your work experience and join us on this incredible journey.

About Us:

Quantum-Systems is at the forefront of autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics globally. Our Australian subsidiary, Quantum-Systems Australia, operates in the Defence, Security, and Commercial markets, specialising in Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles (UAS) in the Asia-Pacific region.

Summary:

Develop, maintain, and enhance Linux-based applications and systems for unmanned aircraft, ensuring reliable integration of hardware, third-party software, and team-delivered components. The position is accountable for designing and documenting system interfaces and architecture, managing build systems and release pipelines, and coordinating across teams and suppliers. It encompasses the full lifecycle of software and system support, including systematic analysis, risk assessment, testing at all levels, and fault investigation during development, production, and in-service operations.

Responsibilities:

Maintaining existing, as well as creating new Linux applications on the unmanned aircraft.
Designing and coordinating interfaces between teams, documenting the architecture and design decisions.
Integration of hardware and 3rd-party software into the Linux system, aligning with suppliers and other teams.
Testing of existing and new applications. This includes writing unit tests, integration tests, functional tests, and acceptance tests.
Analysing logs from both test flights as well as real-world customer issues.
Fault finding and issue tracking in production and maintenance.
Conduct systematic analysis and risk assessment, implementing strategies to mitigate potential obstacles and ensure success. 

Qualifications & Experience:

Required

Tertiary degree in Software Engineering, or related field, or equivalent relevant experience.
3+ years of experience in Linux software development, preferably in embedded or robotics systems.
Australian Citizenship and ability to hold a Security Clearance.
Strong proficiency in C/C++ (14 or newer) with proven experience developing Linux applications.
Solid understanding of Linux internals, including system services, device trees, and kernel modules.
Experience with cross-compilation, Yocto, Buildroot, or similar build systems.
Hands-on experience with debugging tools (e.g., GDB, strace, perf) and log analysis.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems (e.g., Git), and release management.
Knowledge of WPF, XAML, QT, QML.
Basic knowledge of communication protocols (HTTP, UDP/TCP, MAVLink, Serial, Ethernet).

Desired

Familiarity with middleware and interface standards such as DDS.
Knowledge of containerisation technologies (e.g., Docker) and virtualisation.
Prior experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment.

Why Join Us?

We offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our employees are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

Note: A Defence security clearance is required for this role, so your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this position.

What are you waiting for? We’d love you to join us and make your mark in the exciting world of Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles!

APPLY NOW!

Quantum-Systems Pty Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices and encourage applications from all suitably skilled candidates.

Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process.

Job description


At BAE Systems Australia

Do interesting work that MATTERS
ENJOY what you do
GROW your career
Be YOU

We work in a thriving sector – one that puts us at the forefront of exciting and meaningful work. Every day we push boundaries to produce some of the world's most innovative and groundbreaking technology. Individually we all contribute to our success. Collectively we make the impossible possible.

Recognised for delivering projects of global and national significance that help keep Australia safe, it is our shared passion that shapes our culture, and our people that make it a great place to work.

About the OPPORTUNITY

We have an exciting opportunity for two Systems Engineers to join our Surveillance & Communications Program based at Adelaide & Melbourne, reporting to the Systems Engineering Lead.

We embrace flexible work arrangements at BAE Systems Australia, such as working a 9-day fortnight and/or hybrid working.

You will be responsible for working with other members of the Systems Team, under direction and in support of the Systems Engineering Lead. They will also work with the other project design (software, hardware, mechanical, etc.) Engineers and support teams to ensure a systems-orientated, integrated approach to the project engineering development and verification activities.

Key responsibilities include:

Provide systems engineering input across all stages of the product life cycle, from requirements elicitation through to integration, test and acceptance.
Determine appropriate requirement sets for use in HF products
Utilise domain, discipline and systems engineering knowledge to enable, support and deliver products robustly, demonstrating they meet their requirements and are fit for purpose.
Perform analyses to define and characterise the system and its components.
Create test plans and procedures in support of the system verification and validation program.
Provide support to the product integration team, and conduct factory acceptance test activities within the local test facilities (located in Adelaide and Melbourne).
Create and manage systems engineering artefacts within the Jazz suite of requirements management tools (DOORS Next and ETM) and Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) tool Cameo Systems Modeler.

About YOU

A University degree level engineering qualification preferably within a Systems, Electronics, Software or Mechatronics discipline.
Demonstrated systems engineering experience coupled with engineering experience in a relevant discipline.
Proven ability to function confidently within a project team environment with demonstrated problem solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work well within a team environment or autonomously.
Ability to partner with and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to obtain the necessary deliverables.
Experience with MBSE – Model Based Systems Engineering - is considered desirable.
Defence security clearance or eligibility to obtain NV1 Clearance.
Eligibility to be cleared for International Traffic In Arms (ITAR) regulations.

We believe in hiring for potential, we know that some candidates hesitate if they don't tick all the boxes.  If this role interests you, but you don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply.

About US

You will be joining a workplace that truly cares about your wellbeing.

Our people are diverse and we value the variety of perspectives this brings, we know that a culture that is inclusive and fosters a sense of belonging is a place we can all make the most of our unique talents and be our best.

As Australia's largest defence company in a rapidly growing sector, you will be connected into a global team and encouraged to explore where your career might take you whether that is a traditional career path or squiggly one, there are infinite possibilities for you at BAE Systems Australia. 

BAE Systems recognises the sacrifices of those who have served our Nation and their families.  We support our veteran community through our internal veteran network (VetNet Australia) and strong charitable partnerships, internal offerings including reserve service leave, a Veteran Mentoring Program and other exclusive offerings available through our strategic partners.

We welcome applicants from all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, pregnancy, age, or other lived experience; and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all positions.

We are proud to be recognised as an employer of choice for women by WORK180.

Awarded the 2024 Quarter 1 Benchmarcx Triple R- Excellence In Candidate Experience Certification. As a member of the Circle Back Initiative we commit to respond to every applicant.

To learn more about our competitive employee benefits, flexibility, other employment opportunities and what to expect from our recruitment process please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

Clearances

As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and either possess or be eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearances. Further information regarding security clearances.

International Traffic In Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor
